intro: Distegocarpus carpinus, commonly known as the European hornbeam, is a deciduous tree native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its dense, smooth bark and small, oval leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers in catkins, followed by elongated, winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream valleys. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological and ornamental purposes.
